results.title: Two blades of grass
results.creator_credit: S.T. Evans and CSIRO. Film Unit
results.brief_description: Develops the theme that Australia’s agricultural future could depend on the use of a properly fertilised legume. The role of the legume nodule in this respect and in opening up new areas is stressed.
results.description: Develops the theme that Australia’s agricultural future could depend on the use of a properly fertilised legume. The role of the legume nodule in this respect and in opening up new areas is stressed.

results.title: Two-colour separation studies
results.brief_description: A variety of still life, landscape and portrait studies in both red/green and orange/blue systems are accompanied by a detailed explanation by Arthur Cantrill of the process and history of the two colour separation system. Includes a simulation of the Kinemacolour process which alternated red and green frames.

results.title: Twins: matching genes
results.creator_credit: Heather Cook and Canadian Broadcasting Corporation
results.brief_description: Examines the progress made since 1936 when Dr Norma Ford Walker established a Twin Register: explains how fraternal and identical twins develop; shows a close examination of the placentas of twins; observes the behaviour of a set of identical twins; and concludes with a pair of identical twins separated shortly after birth reminiscing about their discovery of each other after twenty-four years. Suitable for middle and upper secondary levels.

Suitable for middle and upper secondary levels.

results.title: Twenty men and a leader
results.creator_credit: Donald Carter, BFI and Gaumont-British Instructional
results.brief_description: A spare-time class of recreative gymnastics: corrective exercises, vaulting, hurdling, cartwheels, obsticle races and various other team games and competitions are included in this demonstration of basic physical culture.

results.title: Twentieth century slavery
results.creator_credit: British Broadcasting Corporation, National Educational Television and Unesco
results.brief_description: An examination of the policy of apartheid and the history of white domination in South Africa. While the native population maintains the country’s booming economy by providing a cheap labour force, the white population exercise strict control over every facet of native life and have created what is virtually a slave population.

results.title: Twentieth century focus: health hazards. Part 3. Drugs
results.creator_credit: Gordon Croton and British Broadcasting Corporation
results.brief_description: Attempts to present a factual picture of drug-taking in Britain today. It deals with the extent of addiction, the social and medical effects, the legal situation, examines attempts being made to confront the problem.

results.creator_credit: Peter Seabourne, John Seabourne, Anvil Film and Recording Group, Educational Foundation for Visual Aids and Seabourne Enterprises
